personal.name: Neil Chen
personal.title: AI-Driven Development Practitioner ¬∑ Software QA Engineer @ QNAP
personal.description: Building on QA automation expertise, actively exploring practical AI applications in workflows. From test case generation to ticket management and documentation collaboration, continuously experimenting and implementing various AI-assisted solutions. Believing AI is not just a tool, but an opportunity to transform how we work ‚Äî aiming to become an engineer who leverages AI to create value.

education.major: Electrical Engineering (Intelligent Robot Lab - Robotics Engineering)
education.activities: Lab leader responsible for annual research planning, progress management, and task allocation. Led team to participate in FIRA RoboWorld Cup international robotics competition, developing team coordination and project execution skills.

Joined Intelligent Robot Lab in freshman year, accumulating four years of robotics development and AI application experience. Served as Vice President of Department Student Association and Class Representative, developing leadership and communication skills.

AI Smart Application New Generation Talent Program - Industrial Robotics

aiProjects.title: AI-Assisted Personal Website
aiProjects.description: Built this website from scratch using GitHub Copilot (Claude). Described requirements in natural language ‚Üí AI generated base architecture ‚Üí Iteratively refined design through conversation ‚Üí Established JSON-driven architecture ‚Üí Created CLAUDE.md collaboration guidelines. Zero hand-written code, entirely developed through AI conversation.

features.text: Full natural language development, zero hand-written code
Wood-tone dark theme with responsive layout
JSON-driven architecture, no HTML editing for content updates
CLAUDE.md collaboration spec for AI maintainability

aiProjects.title: Robot Framework AI-Assisted Testing
aiProjects.description: Integrated GitHub Copilot into Robot Framework test development. Provided existing architecture and conventions to AI ‚Üí Described test requirements ‚Üí AI generated compliant test cases ‚Üí Manual review for logic verification ‚Üí Executed and validated. Also used for batch refactoring existing test files to meet new standards.

features.text: Added 7 HA environment test cases covering Thick/Thin/Dedupe
Batch refactored 16 test files, unified code style
Fixed shared keyword compatibility issues
Reduced test case development from hours to under 30 minutes

aiProjects.title: Jira Ticket Automation
aiProjects.description: Built complete automation system with Claude Skills + Jira REST API. Issue commands in natural language via Claude ‚Üí Skill calls corresponding JS script ‚Üí Script executes API operations ‚Üí Claude formats results for readability. Features include ticket queries, label management, status transitions, and weekly summary automation. Full support for macOS and Windows.

features.text: Natural language ticket queries with multiple filters
One-click batch label add/remove for AI task classification
Weekly AI Summary auto-generates work reports
Automated status transitions reduce repetitive work

aiProjects.title: Git Workflow Automation Suite
aiProjects.description: PowerShell script suite developed with AI assistance for daily Git operations. Execute commit ‚Üí Auto-format message ‚Üí Push and create MR ‚Üí Auto-assign reviewer ‚Üí Send Teams notification. Includes initialization script for one-click deployment by new team members. Deployed across QA team.

features.text: Auto-format commit messages to team standards
One-click GitLab MR creation with auto-assigned reviewers
Auto Teams notification on MR creation
One-click initialization for new team members

aiProjects.title: AI Collaboration Best Practices
aiProjects.description: Systematic documentation from real AI collaboration experience. Includes debugging rules (avoid repeated pitfalls) ‚Üí Prompt templates (improve AI comprehension) ‚Üí Environment setup guides (ensure tools work correctly) ‚Üí Workflow standards (define best processes). Shared within department to help colleagues quickly adopt AI-assisted development.

features.text: 16 debugging rules documenting common issues and solutions
Standardized prompt templates for better AI responses
Environment setup guides ensuring proper tool operation
Department-wide sharing to accelerate adoption

aiProjects.title: Bug Title Generator
aiProjects.description: Claude Skill for automated standardized bug titles. Paste bug description ‚Üí AI extracts key info (module, issue type, trigger conditions) ‚Üí Generates standardized title per team conventions. Solves inconsistent naming styles, improves bug tracking searchability.

features.text: Auto-extract module, issue type, and trigger conditions
Generate standardized titles per team conventions
Improved searchability for tracking and statistics
